dialogue.text: 「Wow . . . look at that . . . he’s not here now! So why not have a go? They might be able to find you a double cell in Azkaban with your loser of a husband!」
Don't you dare talk to my mother like that, Potter!
「I think this left sleeve could come up a little bit more, dear, let me just —」
「Ouch! Watch where you’re putting your pins, woman! Mother — I don’t think I want these anymore —」

「Harry Harry looked quickly around and spotted a large black cabinet to his left; he shot inside it and pulled the doors closed, leaving a small crack to peer through. Seconds later, a bell clanged, and Malfoy stepped into the shop.」
「I heard enough, Malfoy. Your true colors are showing, aren't they? Plotting with Crabbe and Goyle, attempting to harm me and my friends. You really are a pathetic excuse for a wizard.」
「So how did you get in here?」
"I virtually lived in the Room of Hidden Things all last year, I know how to get in."
「Harry spell to the rampart」
"Expelliarmus!"
「STOP!」

「Oh, Potter, getting touchy, are we? Can't handle a little truth? It must be hard being constantly overshadowed by the greatness of the Malfoy name. But don't worry, I'm sure you're used to it by now.」
「Hagrid Everyone gather ’round the fence here!」
"Oh, look who it is, the famous trio of troublemakers. What mischief are you up to now?"
「Hagrid book tried to bite, but Hagrid ran a giant forefinger down its spine, and the book shivered, and then fell open and lay quiet in his hand」
「Well, well, well, if it isn't the famous trio of troublemakers. What mischief are you up to now?」
「We're not up to anything, Malfoy. Just leave us alone.」

「Oh, I see. Trying to defend your precious Hagrid, are you? Pathetic. I can't wait to see him humiliated in front of the Committee. It's about time someone put those dangerous creatures of his in their place.」
「You don't know anything, Malfoy. Hagrid's a great teacher and his creatures aren't dangerous if you treat them with respect.」
「Respect? Ha! That's rich coming from you lot. I suppose you think you're experts on magical creatures now, do you? Well, I'll be sure to laugh when Hagrid's precious hippogriff gets its punishment.」
「You're just jealous, Malfoy. Jealous that Hagrid has a genuine passion for magical creatures while you're stuck with your pure-blood arrogance.」

「Jealous? Me? Don't make me laugh, Granger. I have nothing to be jealous of. My family's status and bloodline speak for themselves. Enjoy your little defense of Hagrid while it lasts. It won't change the fact that he's a failure.」
「Hagrid action」
"You're not dying, Malfoy. It's just a scratch. Stop being so dramatic."

「Keep your voice down! If your friends Crabbe and Goyle intend to pass their Defense Against the Dark Arts O.W.L. this time around, they will need to work a little harder than they are doing at pres —」

"It's quite amusing, isn't it? The thought of Crabbe and Goyle actually passing their Defense Against the Dark Arts O.W.L. exams. I highly doubt they possess the intellect or skill required. But I suppose miracles can happen, even in the realm of academic incompetence."

「It is an act that is crucial to success, Draco! Where do you think I would have been all these years, if I had not known how to act? Now listen to me! You are being incautious, wandering around at night, getting yourself caught, and if you are placing your reliance in assistants like Crabbe and Goyle —」
"They're not the only ones, I've got other people on my side, better people!"
「angrily」

"Quit yer whining, Malfoy! Nobody wants to hear your complaints. If your arm is bothering you, maybe you should have thought twice before getting yourself into trouble. Now, let's get on with the lesson and stop wasting everyone's time."
「Does it hurt much?」
「Oh, Pansy, you're so concerned about my well-being. How touching. But rest assured, the pain is nothing compared to the agony of having to associate with certain individuals.」
「There’s nothing wrong with your arm」

"Oh, Weasley, always so observant. But I assure you, my arm is in excruciating pain. Perhaps you're just jealous of the attention I'm receiving. It must be tough being overshadowed by the great Draco Malfoy."
「Ron shoved his own beautifully cut roots across the table at Malfoy」
「Oh, how brave of you, Weasley. But I wouldn't expect anything less from someone like you. Always trying to prove yourself, aren't you?」
「Keep talking, Malfoy, and I’ll give you a real injury」
「Oh, Weasley, always so brave when you have your friends around. But we both know you wouldn't dare face me alone.」
「Ron no dialogue, not sticking up for Harry」
「Leave him alone, Malfoy.」
「Anyway, we’ve got to go, Lee Jordan reckons he’s found a new secret passageway out of the school. Bet it’s that one behind the statue of Gregory the Smarmy that we found in our first week. See you.」

「Oh, look who it is, the Weasley twins. Going on another mischievous adventure, are we? How predictable. Don't get your hopes up too high, I'm sure it's just another one of your pathetic pranks. Goodbye, losers.」
「You’re a lot braver now that you’re back on the ground and you’ve got your little friends with you.」

「Oh, Potter, always trying to diminish my triumphs. But let's not forget, I am a natural-born leader, surrounded by loyal companions. It's only natural for them to revel in my successes. Unlike you, who always seems to rely on luck and the support of others.」
「Come on, Harry!」
"Oh, Granger, always so eager to follow Potter around like a lost puppy. Can't you think for yourself?"
「Harry feeling hot from their climb, was just considering taking off the Cloak for a few minutes」

"Potter, what are you up to? Sneaking around under your Invisibility Cloak, are you? Trying to eavesdrop on our conversation, I presume? Typical Gryffindor behavior, always meddling and prying into other people's business."
「sniggered.」
「I wouldn’t go out with you if it was a choice between you and the giant squid,」
「I’m not an owl!」
「You look like one. What’s that supposed to be anyway?」
「Can’t you tell? It’s a broomstick.」
「Oh, honestly, don’t you know anything about Muggle sports?」
「Harry action」
*rolls his eyes* "Oh, look who's here, the ever-observant Draco Malfoy. What's the matter, Malfoy? Jealous that you don't have the guts to face magical creatures like the rest of us?"
「Thank you, Harry Potter!」
"Oh, look, it's the house-elf again. Potter, do you have a fan club now? How utterly pathetic."
「That sounds good, sir.」
"Oh, look who's here, the Mudblood and her little sidekick. What are you two doing in my presence?"
「hand shot into the air.」
*Rolls eyes* "What is it, Granger? Another attempt to show off your know-it-all nature?"
「Say that again.」

"Oh, Weasley, are you still here? I thought you would have run off to hide behind Potter by now. But to answer your question, Potter's scar is none of your concern. It's a mark of his fame, something you could never understand."
「Malfoy continued walking」
"Potter, what are you doing here? Can't you find your own compartment? Typical Gryffindor, always sticking your nose where it doesn't belong."
「“Hermione — who are you going to the ball with?” said Ron.」
「You're joking, Weasley! You're not telling me someone's asked that to the ball? Not the long-molared Mudblood?」
「What?」

"Oh, Potter, always so dense. I'm simply pointing out the obvious. Weasley seems to outshine you in every way, doesn't he? Quidditch skills, intelligence, even his family's wealth. It must be quite frustrating for you, being forever in his shadow."
「Shut up, Malfoy.」
"Oh, Granger, always so eager to silence me. But I must say, your attempts are quite feeble. It's clear that your intellect pales in comparison to mine."
「Mrs. Weasley told reporters to clear off or she’d set the family ghoul on them」
Oh, how amusing! The Weasley family resorting to threats with their ghoul. How typical of them to rely on such lowly tactics. It seems they have no other means to defend themselves. Pathetic, really.
「Ha, ha」
「Enjoy your little victory while you can, Potter. It won't last long.」

「He would have been looking forward to seeing Hagrid under normal circumstances, but Care of Magical Creatures meant seeing the Slytherins too — the first time he would come face-to-face with them since becoming champion.」
「Well, today we're gonna be learnin' about Hippogriffs. Beautiful creatures, they are. Half horse, half bird, yeh know. Now, who wants to come and meet one up close?」
「guffawed sycophantically」
「You know, Malfoy, some people might say it's pathetic that you always need your cronies to back you up. Can't handle a fair fight, can you?」
「We must agree to differ on that, Draco. It so happens that I trust Professor Snape —」
Trusting Snape, are we, Dumbledore? How naive of you. But then again, you always did have a soft spot for the undeserving.
「Well, bully for Professor Vector」

Oh, Weasley, always quick with a sarcastic remark, aren't you? But I must say, your wit is as feeble as ever. It's no surprise that Potter's attention is elsewhere, considering the lack of substance in your words.
「refused to answer Daily Prophet questions about why he had involved the Ministry in such an undignified and potentially embarrassing scene」

「Well, well, well, Weasley. Looks like your father got himself into quite a mess, didn't he? Involved in an undignified and potentially embarrassing scene. I must say, it's rather amusing to see the Weasley family constantly making headlines for all the wrong reasons.」
「I’ll do that, then, staring at Malfoy with great dislike.」
Well, well, if it isn't the famous Moody. What brings you here, eyeing me with such disdain? I must say, your presence is quite underwhelming.
「Well, I know your father of old, boy. . . . You tell him Moody’s keeping a close eye on his son . . . you tell him that from me. . . . Now, your Head of House’ll be Snape, will it?」

「Yes, it seems that way. Not that it matters much to me. Snape or anyone else, they're all just pawns in this game. But I'm sure my father will be thrilled to hear that Moody is keeping such a close eye on me. It must be quite amusing for him.」
「What d’you reckon’s wrong with him? You don’t think a skrewt — ?」
Oh, Potter, always jumping to conclusions, aren't you? But no, it's not a skrewt this time. Perhaps Hagrid finally realized his incompetence and decided to hide away in shame. Can't say I blame him.
「What d’you mean?」

Oh, Potter, always so clueless. It's quite entertaining, really. You see, I find your lack of knowledge amusing. It seems you're incapable of comprehending the simplest of things. But don't worry, I'll enlighten you. You're just not good enough, Potter. Not good enough to surpass Weasley, not good enough to match my talents, and certainly not good enough to be in my league. So, do yourself a favor and accept your inferiority. It's quite pathetic, really.

「Nobody at Hogwarts knew the truth of what had happened the night that Sirius, Buckbeak, and Pettigrew had vanished except Harry, Ron, Hermione, and Professor Dumbledore. As the end of term approached, Harry heard many different theories about what had really happened, but none of them came close to the truth.」
「Well, well, Potter. It seems you've been keeping quite the secret, haven't you? But don't worry, the truth has a way of revealing itself eventually.」
「He might not be very good company, but Professor Lupin’s presence in their compartment had its uses.」
「Well, well, if it isn't the famous Professor Lupin. I must say, your presence here is quite unexpected. What brings you to our compartment?」
「chuckled trollishly.」

「You know, Malfoy, I think you're just jealous because you don't have the talent or the courage to face challenges like Hagrid does. Maybe you should focus on improving yourself instead of spreading baseless rumors.」
「Who’s that?」
「New teacher, Professor Lupin.」
「Crabbe swung trunk and hit Harry hard on the side of the head」
「Give it here, or I’ll knock you off that broom!」
「What’s going on?」
"Oh, Professor McGonagall, just witnessing the amusing sight of Weasley here desperately trying to pick up some imaginary money. Quite entertaining, I must say."

「Professor Slughorn, I discovered this boy lurking in an upstairs corridor. He claims to have been invited to your party and to have been delayed in setting out. Did you issue him with an invitation?」
「All right, I wasn’t invited! I was trying to gate-crash, happy?」
「If your son is dead, Lucius, it is not my fault. He did not come and join me, like the rest of the Slytherins. Perhaps he has decided to befriend Harry Potter?」

Oh, look who decided to grace us with his presence. Potter, I see you're still struggling with your potions skills. Remedial Potions, how embarrassing. Perhaps you should consider a different career path, one that doesn't require any actual talent or intelligence.

"Oh, Parkinson, you never cease to amaze me with your lack of wit. But I suppose it's no surprise, considering your own family's lack of distinction. Now, if you'll excuse me, I have more important matters to attend to than engaging in pointless banter with the likes of you."
「No」

「Well, well, well, Weasley. Looks like you're still as pathetic as ever. Can't even find a date to the ball, can you? And to think, I was almost starting to believe that you had a chance at being remotely interesting. But alas, you remain a pitiful excuse for a wizard.」
「We’re taking Hufflepuff very seriously. Seriously.」
Oh, please, Weasley. As if anyone would take Hufflepuff seriously. They're nothing more than a bunch of mediocre wizards and witches.

「Are you okay, Hagrid?, You’re on probation?, How much more bad news he could stand., The fact that Hagrid was now on probation became common knowledge within the school over the next few days, There was only one topic of conversation in the corridors now」

"Oh, look who's here, Potter and his little gang of misfits. What's this I hear about Hagrid being on probation? Seems like the oaf finally got what he deserved. Can't say I'm surprised, really. It was only a matter of time before his incompetence caught up with him. I must say, it's quite entertaining to see him squirming under the Ministry's watchful eye. I wonder how much more bad news he can handle before he completely crumbles."
「Shut up!」
"Oh, Potter, scared of a little snake, are we? How pathetic. Serpensortia!"

「I did not dare speak to you of the mission with which I knew you had been entrusted, in case he used Legilimency against you. But now at last we can speak plainly to each other. . . . No harm has been done, you have hurt nobody, though you are very lucky that your unintentional victims survived. . . . I can help you, Draco.」
Help me? Why would I need your help, Dumbledore? I am perfectly capable of handling my own affairs. I don't need assistance from the likes of you.
「What’s happening? Why aren’t you playing? And what’s he doing here?」

"Oh, Weasley, always so eager to jump into a fight, aren't you? But I'm afraid I have more important matters to attend to than engaging in your petty squabbles. As for what I'm doing here, it's quite obvious, isn't it? I'm simply observing, as any astute individual would do."
「At least no one on the Gryffindor team had to buy their way in. They got in on pure talent.」

"Oh, Granger, still clinging to that delusion, are you? Talent can only take you so far. It's the connections and resources that truly make a difference. But I suppose you wouldn't understand that, being a Mudblood and all."
「On my whistle. Three . . . two . . . one . . .」
*zooms off on his broom*
「If I see you do that again I’ll jinx your fingers together, Mum, can I have a Pygmy Puff?, A what?, Look, they’re so sweet. . . .」

Oh, how typical of the Weasley family to be fascinated by such trivial creatures. Pygmy Puffs are nothing more than fluffy distractions. I, on the other hand, have more important matters to attend to.
「So, Zabini, what did Slughorn want?」
「Just trying to make up to well-connected people. Not that he managed to find many.」
「McLaggen from Gryffindor. someone else called Belby, from Ravenclaw. Longbottom, Potter, and that Weasley girl.」
「He invited Longbottom?」
「You have these, I’ll buy my own —」

"Oh, Weasley, always so eager to spend your family's meager fortune. I suppose you can't resist the allure of these exquisite items. But don't worry, I wouldn't dream of contaminating your precious money with my own. It's far too pure for your taste, I'm sure."
「Oh, it’s you. Bet you’re surprised to see Harry here, eh?」
「Not as surprised as I am to see you in a shop, Weasley. I suppose your parents will go hungry for a month to pay for all those.」
「I am a prefect. Nothing’s about to attack me.」

"Oh, there you are, Weasley. Still clinging to that prefect badge, I see. As if it makes any difference. You're just a Weasley after all, no matter how hard you try to pretend otherwise. And as for you, Potter, always Dumbledore's little pet, aren't you? It must be exhausting, constantly living in his shadow."
「Percy.」
「Oh, look, Potter's got himself a girlfriend!」
「Er —」
「You'll soon find out some wizarding families are much better than others, Potter. You don't want to go making friends with the wrong sort. I can help you there.」
「Harry and Ron followed him」
「What are you two doing here? Can't you see I'm busy?」
「Ho!」
「It's none of your business, Malfoy.」

"Oh, look who it is, the trio of misfits. Still hanging around with Hagrid, are you? Can't say I'm surprised. Birds of a feather, after all."
「Shove off, Malfoy.」
"Oh, Weasley, always so eloquent. But I must insist on an answer. How much did he hear, Potter?"

While the Gryffindor common room and the Great Hall had roaring fires, the drafty corridors had become icy and a bitter wind rattled the windows in the classrooms. "Ah, the holidays are finally upon us. A time for those of us with distinguished bloodlines and esteemed family positions to revel in our superiority.
